meanings.definition: To officially agree to or accept something
meanings.sent1: The teacher approves the students' project proposal.
meanings.sent2: The committee approves the new policy changes.
meanings.sent3: The cat approves the new scratching post with a nod of approval.
meanings.sent4: The sun approves the flowers by shining brightly upon them.
meanings.sent5: The judge approves the verdict with a decisive bang of the gavel.

meanings.definition: To think that something is good or acceptable
meanings.sent1: She approves of the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent2: He approves the idea of having a picnic this weekend.
meanings.sent3: The dog approves of the belly rubs he's receiving.
meanings.sent4: The wind approves of the kite flying high in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The child approves the taste of the ice cream with a big smile.
